title: Milatovic declares victory in Montenegro presidential election
description: Montenegro's long-ruling leader Milo Djukanovic acknowledged defeat to Jakov Milatovic.

title: Can countries remain neutral in today’s Europe?
description: When Finland becomes a NATO member, only a handful of European nations will be non-aligned militarily.

title: Blinken calls on Russia to release WSJ reporter
description: Blinken spoke to Russian FM Sergey Lavrov to call for the release of Evan Gershkovich, the State Department said.

title: Reformist bloc leads Bulgaria parliamentary election: Exit polls
description: The reformist bloc, comprised of two parties, is expected to struggle to form a stable coalition government.

title: Finland’s NCP narrowly leads PM Marin in early election count
description: With 40.1 percent of votes counted, opposition party leads PM's party by 0.1 percent, according to justice ministry.

title: Prominent Russian military blogger killed in cafe blast: Reports
description: Explosion in a St Petersburg cafe kills a blogger with 560,000 followers on Telegram, Russia news agencies say.

title: OPEC+ oil alliance announces surprise production cuts from May
description: Gulf oil giants lead coordinated cut in production, calling it a 'precautionary measure' aimed at market stability.

title: Israeli cabinet approves funds for national guard under Ben-Gvir
description: PM Netanyahu's office says cabinet approved establishment of the force and a committee will determine its authorities.

title: Japan’s foreign minister urges China to release jailed national
description: Diplomat protests against pharmaceutical worker's jailing in first visit by foreign minister to Beijing in three years.

title: UK home secretary says Rwanda is safe for asylum seekers
description: Suella Braverman declines to set any deadline for the first deportations to the East African country.

title: Algerian journalist Ihsane El Kadi sentenced to five years
description: El Kadi has to serve three years of his sentence in prison. His media company has been shuttered and heavily fined.

title: Iraq, KRG reach deal to resume oil exports: Kurdish official
description: Turkey had stopped extracting oil from the Kurdish region to its Ceyhan port after Iraq won an arbitration case.

title: Three UK citizens held in Taliban custody in Afghanistan
description: Non-profit says charity medic, traveller and unnamed third man 'being well-treated' as UK foreign office seeks contact.

title: Burkina Faso expels two journalists working for French newspapers
description: The expulsions are the latest crackdown against French media by the military ruling the West African country.

title: Montenegro votes for president in tight run-off
description: Observers say that President Milo Djukanovic faces stiff challenge from newcomer and economist Jakov Milatovic.

title: Now is the time for the world to support the people of Türkiye
description: The human and material losses from the earthquakes are staggering; Türkiye needs international help to rebuild.

title: Last students graduate: School closures spread in ageing Japan
description: As Japan's birth rate plunges faster than expected, school closures have picked up pace especially in rural areas.

title: Finland’s Sanna Marin faces tough challenge in re-election bid
description: Three parties are in a neck-and-neck race to win a majority of Finland's 200-seat parliament and form a new government.

title: Deadly tornadoes leave trail of devastation across US states
description: Storms that dropped dozens of tornadoes killed at least 26 people in towns and cities across the US South and Midwest.

title: ‘Stand-up’ for Ukraine: Coping through comedy in the face of war
description: In Berlin, comedians from Ukraine and Russia share the same stage as an outlet for their grief and anger about the war.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 403
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 403rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Bulgarians vote in fifth parliamentary elections in two years
description: Bulgarians head to polls amid voter apathy and disillusionment over endemic corruption and political instability.

title: Russia, Belarus celebrate ‘unity’ as war grinds on in Ukraine
description: The ex-Soviet allies have grown closer and Lukashenko's dalliances with the West appear to be over, say analysts.

title: Ukraine court puts Metropolitan Pavel under house arrest
description: Metropolitan Pavel put under house arrest amid hearings into whether he glorified invading Russian forces.

title: Israeli soldier kills Palestinian in West Bank as violence rises
description: Fatal shooting comes hours after an Israeli policeman shot dead another Palestinian man near the Al-Aqsa compound.

title: Israel attacks Syria’s Homs, wounds five soldiers: Ministry
description: Air attack on Homs is the third in recent days, including one that killed two advisers to Iran's Revolutionary Guard.
